intro: Orthocarpus bicolor, commonly known as the yellow thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features spiny leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils. Orthocarpus bicolor is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine by some indigenous communities.
